definitions.definition: to ask somebody for something especially in an anxious way because you want or need it very much
definitions.sensetop: beg for somethingbeg somebody for somethingbeg somebodybeg somethingbeg something of/from somebodybeg (somebody) + speechbeg somebody to do somethingbeg to do somethingbeg that…beg of somebodybeg somebody's something

examples.text: Now you have to **beg and plead**.
He wants to see them **beg for mercy**.
They begged him for help.
Forgive me, I beg you!
She begged permission to leave.
I managed to beg a lift from a passing motorist.
Can I beg a favour of you?
‘Give me one more chance,’ he begged (her).
I begged him not to go.
He begged to be told the truth.
She begged that she be allowed to go.
She begged that she should be allowed to go.
Don't leave me here, I beg of you!
I have come to apologize and to beg your forgiveness.
We went to him to beg for forgiveness.
In the end they almost begged him to take the job.
We humbly beg Your Majesty to show mercy.

definitions.definition: to ask somebody for money, food, etc., especially in the street
definitions.sensetop: beg for somethingbeg for something from somebodybeg something from somebodybeg something

examples.text: A young woman was begging in the street.
a begging letter *(= one that asks somebody for money)*
a begging bowl *(= used to beg for money with)*
The children were begging for food.
They will have to beg for money from tourists.
We managed to beg a meal from the cafe owner.
They went off to beg food.

definitions.definition: if a dog begs, it sits on its back legs with its front legs in the air, waiting to be given something
to ask somebody for permission to do something

examples.text: I beg leave to add a few comments of my own.

definitions.definition: if something is going begging, it is available because nobody else wants it

examples.text: I’ll have that last cake if it’s going begging.

definitions.definition: to ask somebody to forgive you for something you have said or done

examples.text: He returned to beg her pardon for his sudden outburst.

definitions.definition: to make somebody want to ask a question that has not yet been answered

examples.text: All of which begs the question as to who will fund the project.

definitions.definition: to talk about something as if it were definitely true, even though it might not be

examples.text: These assumptions beg the question that children learn languages more easily than adults.

definitions.definition: used to tell somebody that you are sorry for something you have said or done

examples.text: I beg your pardon, I thought that was my coat.

definitions.definition: used to ask somebody to repeat what they have just said because you did not hear

examples.text: ‘It's on Duke Street.’ ‘I beg your pardon.’ ‘Duke Street.’

definitions.definition: used to tell somebody that you are offended by what they have just said or by the way that they have said it

examples.text: ‘Just go away.’ ‘I beg your pardon!’

definitions.definition: used to say politely that you do not agree with something that has just been said

examples.text: ‘At least she is good at her job.’ ‘Oh, I beg to differ.’

wordOrigin: Middle English: probably from Old English bedecian, of Germanic origin; related to bid2.
